answers.answer: Oh goodness.. hope things get better
U need to drink a lot of water i was going through the same thing they had me drinking a gallon of water everyday  u can add some flavor to it so it will keep ur fluid up
I'm glad they got your fluid up and you can rest at home! Hoping things remain good over the weekend and get better
Thanks ladies and rorosimeon yes I know I'm consistently drinking water but it was not helping I live in Redding were the weather its crazy hot.

I'm hovering around 6.5 too. 6.5 is good! That is technically out of oligohydramnios range! Every time I go for another AFI I just say 5 or higher and we're good. Is your C scheduled or are they just monitoring and you could go any time?
And I seriously can't drink more water. I might as well live in the bathroom.

Hi Rabecca, I'm so sorry you're having a tough time! Seems like things have gotten stressful over recent weeks. On the bright side, I'm glad baby is able to stay in a little longer... That's the best place for her. Good luck ❤ keep your chin up :-)

6.5 is not good its supposed to be 14 but yes over 5 is out of the danger zone. My c section has not been scheduled but it will be Mon and not due to my fluid its because she is breech and can not turn because there's not enough fluid

For me 6.5 is good because as long as everything else is reassuring then it means I don't have to deliver too early and it means that resting more and hydrating have been enough for me to remain stable without hospitalization or bed rest. It's not what I would choose but I try to stay positive. AFI is an imprecise measurement at best. Whether it's 6.5 or 14 or even below 5 in late pregnancy there is little evidence to suggest poor outcomes for the baby absent other accompanying factors like preeclampsia or non-reassuring NST suggesting cord commpression. It does make vaginal delivery potentially risky especially with a breech. I'm in the exact same boat as you and I do know what it's like. I'm sorry this has been so stressful for you but it sounds like you are receiving good care and that bodes well for both of you. Best of health and joy to you on Monday!

question: My doc sent me to the hospital yesterday morning and I just left there about 10 this mornin. They were able to bring her fluid up from a 2 to 6.5 so just barely out of the danger zone but enougjt to send me home and not have me come back to the doc tell Monday
title: spent the night at the hispital:(
